channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Nation’s Leaders Will Gather to Honor Carter at Washington Cathedral
item.description: A state funeral for the 39th president on Thursday will bring together all five living presidents and feature a eulogy from President Biden.

item.title: Trump’s Territorial Ambitions Rattle a Weary World
item.description: A distant era of global politics, when nations scrambled to grab territory, suddenly seems less distant.

item.title: Who Is Pierre Poilievre, the Conservative Leader on a Path to Become Canada’s Next Prime Minister?
item.description: Pierre Poilievre, the Conservative leader, enjoys a commanding lead in the polls as Canadians look to the next general election.

item.title: In Tibet, Chinese Boarding Schools Reshape the ‘Souls of Children’
item.description: Across China’s west, the Communist Party is placing children in boarding schools to assimilate a generation of Tibetans into the national mainstream a...

item.title: 100,000 Flee Los Angeles Wildfires, and Trump’s Last-Minute Supreme Court Ask
item.description: Plus, don’t eat your Christmas tree.

item.title: U.S. Efforts to Cut Emissions Stalled in 2024 as Power Demand Surged
item.description: After staying flat for nearly two decades, electricity use is starting to rise again, and the boom in wind and solar power hasn’t kept pace.

item.title: DOJ says it plans to hold back part of Jack Smith’s report about Trump’s hoarding classified documents at Mar-a-Lago
item.description: The revelation was made in a filing to a federal appeals court that was considering a defense request to block the release of the two-volume report.

item.title: Welcome to ‘career catfishing’ — Gen Z’s new defiance against endless rounds of interviews and hiring managers who ghost
item.description: About one third of young applicants are not showing up on their first day of work

item.title: Heavy Snow and Ice Is Forecast for Southern U.S. on Thursday and Friday
item.description: A stretch of the United States from Texas and Arkansas to the Carolinas is expected to see significant winter weather on Thursday and Friday.

item.title: Putin Gets a Snub in the Vast Wine Cellars of a Former Soviet Republic
item.description: The Russian president celebrated his 50th birthday at a winery in Moldova. After the invasion of Ukraine, it moved the bottles he was given away from ...

item.title: CEOs react to Zuck’s message to Trump
item.description: Also: Trump considers "state of emergency," eBay stock soars on Facebook news.

item.title: Tim Walz Endorses Ken Martin, a Fellow Minnesotan, to Lead the D.N.C.
item.description: The Minnesota governor and 2024 vice-presidential contender became the highest-profile Democrat to back Mr. Martin, one of the front-runners vying to ...

item.title: Most of the world’s 35,000 online pharmacies are run illegally and consumers who use them risk getting bad drugs, US report warns
item.description: The U.S. Trade Representative’s annual report on “ notorious markets” also singled out 19 countries over concerns about counterfeit or pirated product...

item.title: Putin Gets a Snub in the Vast Wine Cellars of a Former Soviet Republic
item.description: The Russian president celebrated his 50th birthday at a winery in Moldova. After the invasion of Ukraine, it moved the bottles he was given away from ...

item.title: Trump asks the Supreme Court to call off sentencing in his New York hush money case
item.description: Trump's lawyers turned to the nation's highest court on Wednesday after New York courts refused to postpone the sentencing by Judge Juan M. Merchan.
